Formula: Unemployment Rate = (Unemployed √∑ Labour Force) √ó 100%

Note: Labour Force = Employed + Unemployed

Instructions: Give your answer as a percentage to 1 decimal place.

generalfeedback.text:

üìä Economic Analysis: An unemployment rate of 6.4% for prime-age workers (25-54) indicates moderate labour market conditions in Ontario, close to the historical average for this demographic group.

üá®üá¶ Labour Force Statistics - Comprehensive Analysis

Complete labour force analysis for ages 15+ in Nova Scotia during normal economic conditions in August 2023.

Given Labour Market Data:

  • Working Age Population (15+): 820.0 thousand
  • Employed: 485.2 thousand
  • Unemployed: 34.8 thousand
  • National Unemployment Rate: 5.5%
  • National Participation Rate: 65.2%

Calculate the following using Statistics Canada methodology:

Part A: Labour Force = {1:NUMERICAL:=520.0:1.0} thousand

Part B: Unemployment Rate = {1:NUMERICAL:=6.7:0.1}%

Part C: Employment Rate = {1:NUMERICAL:=59.2:0.1}%

Part D: Participation Rate = {1:NUMERICAL:=63.4:0.1}%

Part E: Unemployment Gap vs. National = {1:NUMERICAL:=1.2:0.1} percentage points

Part F: Not in Labour Force = {1:NUMERICAL:=300.0:1.0} thousand

generalfeedback.text:
üí° Complete Solution:

Part A: Labour Force Calculation

Formula: Labour Force = Employed + Unemployed

Calculation: Labour Force = 485.2 + 34.8 = 520.0 thousand

Part B: Unemployment Rate

Formula: Rate = (Unemployed √∑ Labour Force) √ó 100%

Calculation: Rate = (34.8 √∑ 520.0) √ó 100% = 6.7%

Part C: Employment Rate

Formula: Rate = (Employed √∑ Working Age Pop.) √ó 100%

Calculation: Rate = (485.2 √∑ 820.0) √ó 100% = 59.2%

Part D: Participation Rate

Formula: Rate = (Labour Force √∑ Working Age Pop.) √ó 100%

Calculation: Rate = (520.0 √∑ 820.0) √ó 100% = 63.4%

Part E: Unemployment Gap

Formula: Gap = Provincial Rate - National Rate

Calculation: Gap = 6.7% - 5.5% = 1.2 percentage points

Part F: Not in Labour Force

Formula: Not in LF = Working Age Pop. - Labour Force

Calculation: Not in LF = 820.0 - 520.0 = 300.0 thousand

üèñÔ∏è Economic Summary: Nova Scotia shows slightly elevated unemployment (6.7% vs 5.5% national) with moderate participation (63.4%), reflecting the province's seasonal economy and rural demographics. The employment rate of 59.2% indicates steady labour market conditions.
